newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan outward investment up 47 pct Jan-Aug yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan outward investment up 47 pct Jan-Aug yr/yr.

text.p: Taiwan's overseas investment jumped 47 percent in the first eight months of 1996 from the same period a year ago, the government's Investment Commission said on Wednesday.

Taiwanese companies poured US$1.338 billion into the United States, southeast Asia and elsewhere between January and August, up from $909.6 million in the same period in 1995, the commission said in a statement.
Financial and insurance investment overseas in the first eight months totalled $635 million, followed by $146 million in electronic and electric industry, the statement said.
Foreign investment in Taiwan fell 12 percent over the same period to $1.296 billion, of which investment in the domestic electronic industry accounted for $292 million.
